page.title: 14LARKEY VALLEY THANINGTON 1
page.content: Larkey Valley Wood in the Parish of Thanington is situated between Chartham and Canterbury about 3 kilo- metres from the village of Lower Hardres. The 107 acres of woodland were presented to Canterbury City Council by Alderman Frank Hooker in 1932 in order that the wood "should be reserved to the public for ever". The wood is a relic of a forest which has been in existence continuously since the end of the last ice age. Some parts have been re-planted to produce Standards with Coppice which could be cropped for timber. In 1976 the Kent Trust for Nature Conservation with the help of other conservationists pre- pared a management policy for the wood. This is now implemented by Canterbury City Council, with finan- cial assistance from the Countryside Commision.
